description:
{RHelp Topic{W:{x Whitestone Keep
            Kingdom of Caerdonis

Whitestone Keep began as a large shrine to Caerdik, built in the past to
honor a miracle performed by Caerdik. The city itself grew around the
shrine. Before written history, an invading force of unknown origin
laid seige to Whitestone and a large portion of the city was sacked.
Through a miracle of intervention by Caerdik himself, the shrine and a
small portion of the city itself were saved from destruction. Armies gathered
from the various family dukies which arrived too late for the cities defense.
Those armies were put to work on construction of an outer wall the likes of
which had never been seen in Akrios. Working quaries for stone, hauling
and placing stone. Many workers died in the years of construction. Upon it's
completion 9 years later many workers remained in and near Whitestone Keep
adding to it's size and strength.

Whitestone Keep is ruled jointly by law between the King and Praetor of Caerdik.
Although in recent years the high Praetor of Caerdik has given deference to the
King on all matters of the State. Likewise, the King has given deference to the
Praetor in all matters of religion. The nobile families each hold swaths of land
which in turn they behold to barons for military service of their men. The nobles
themselves mainly reside in Whitestone Keep. The priests generally stay out of
most things normally relegated to the secular side of rule. They do not patrol the
streets as the Kings militia does, nor do they hold court.

Priests of Caerdik are held in high regard. Almost as nobility, much to the distress
of the ruling nobles. Whether to keep the priests in line, or merely because they
are curious the King has decreed all goodly races are allowed to enter Whitestone Keep, 
even the overtly feared magic wielders. The common folk hold no fear or distrust
of the other goodly races though the religious order believes them to be inferior as
Caerdik is the creator of Humankind and therefor the superior being. There is one
small 'formal' mages guild, though they cater only to traditional magecraft.
